title: Jacob Rees-Mogg memes: The doctored photographs providing some Brexit relief
text:
Jacob Rees-Mogg on the front bench in the House of Commons - AFP

It was one of the most complex and dramatic days the House of Commons has seen in modern times. But, somehow, one image more than any other stood out.

The photograph of Jacob Rees-Mogg, sitting almost horizontally on the front bench, was widely shared last night with his critics calling it a "physical embodiment of arrogance, entitlement, disrespect and contempt for our parliament".

The Leader of the House of Commons has dismissed criticism of the photograph, but the world of social media has tucked in after it became an instant hit.

For the meme-makers, it was an open goal. And they responded valiantly in their droves.

From famous scenes in films such as the Titanic to using his body to depict the Tory party's dwindling majority, here is the best of them.

The original

Jacob Rees-Mogg on the front bench in the House of Commons Credit: AFP More

The aftermath

Paint me like one of your French girls pic.twitter.com/iIzLUwrcmy — Donaeld The Unready (@donaeldunready) September 4, 2019

A rare Resting Rees-Mogg pattern spotted in sterling. Bearish. pic.twitter.com/VtsWq7IYJn — Tracy Alloway (@tracyalloway) September 4, 2019

So no one told you life was going to be this way. #brexitmeholepic.twitter.com/RAgBq7PJ7a — TwistedDoodles (@twisteddoodles) September 3, 2019

I call this one... The Mogg Pit! pic.twitter.com/IIakwqYEKE — ���������� ���������� (@tommyxcore) September 4, 2019
